subject: Self Care
title: Loving-Kindness Meditation
description: A micro-lesson that makes Loving-Kindness Meditation usable.

hook.text: You silently wish happiness for a stranger. Then for an enemy. Something softens inside that surprises you.

buildup.text: Loving-kindness, or metta, involves directing goodwill toward yourself, loved ones, strangers, and even rivals.

discovery.text: Brain scans show metta increases activity in empathy circuits and reduces activity in judgment centers.

twist.text: The hardest person to direct love toward is often yourself. Self-compassion resists more than you'd expect.

climax.text: Regular metta practice increases positive emotions, reduces bias, and improves social connections measurably.

punchline.text: Wishing others well rewires your own brain for good.

quiz.question: What does loving-kindness meditation train?
options: Directing goodwill toward self, others, and even rivals
